content:
Sure, offering bite-sized packages can be a great way to give customers more flexibility and allow them to purchase only the services that they need. Here's an example of how you might structure bite-sized packages for your services:

1. "Logo Design": This package includes a custom logo design for your business, perfect for startups and small businesses looking for a professional-looking logo.
	* Price: $300
2. "Web Page Design": This package includes design for one web page, perfect for businesses looking for a fresh, modern look for their website.
	* Price: $500
3. "Social Media Design": This package includes custom design for social media profile and posts, perfect for businesses looking to improve their social media presence.
	* Price: $300
4. "Copywriting": This package includes professional copywriting services, perfect for businesses looking to improve their marketing materials and website content.
	* Price: $500
5. "Motion Graphics": This package includes a custom motion graphic design, perfect for businesses looking to create engaging and dynamic video content.
	* Price: $1000
6. "Branding": This package includes a full branding strategy, perfect for businesses looking to create a cohesive and consistent visual identity across all of their materials.
	* Price: $3000
7. "UI/UX": This package includes design for user interface and user experience, perfect for businesses looking to improve the usability and user-friendliness of their website and applications.
	* Price: $3000

You can adjust the price and services to your business need and what you can offer. Additionally, you can also provide an option for custom package for clients, where they can select the specific services they need and get an estimate for the package.

Offering bite-sized packages can be a great way to give customers more flexibility and allow them to purchase only the services that they need, while also providing clear and concise descriptions of each package to help them make informed decisions.
